derivation.yuyuan_name: early 19th cent.: via French from Latin, literally for all', dative plural of omnis

entry.tran: （广播、电视的）汇播节目，综合节目
entry.def: An omnibus edition of a radio or television programme contains two or more similar programmes that were originally broadcast separately.

example.ex: I enjoy the omnibus edition of Eastenders on Sunday.
example.tran: 我喜欢看《伦敦东区》的周日连播版。

entry.tran: （某一作家或主题作品的）选集，汇编
entry.def: An omnibus is a book which contains a large collection of stories or articles, often by a particular person or about a particular subject.

example.ex: ...a new omnibus edition of three Ruth Rendell chillers.
example.tran: 露丝·伦德尔3篇恐怖故事的新选集

means.word_mean: 1. an anthology of articles on a related subject or an anthology of the works of a single author
2. a vehicle carrying many passengers; used for public transport;

sentences.sentence: "he always rode the bus to work"

means.word_mean: 1. providing for many things at once;

stems_affixes.value_cn: 创造一切的, 有无限创造力的
stems_affixes.word_buile: omni全部,到处+fic做+ent……的→做出全部东西
omni全部,到处+potent有力的→adj.全能的
omni全部,到处+present出现的→adj.无所不在的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 全知的, 无所不知的
stems_affixes.word_buile: omni全部,到处+scient有知识的→adj.全知的, 无所不知的;n.无所不知者
omni全部,到处+bus汽车→n.公共汽车
omni全部,到处+scient有知识的→adj.全知的, 无所不知的;n.无所不知者
omni全部,到处+itude状态→omnitude全的状态→无所不包的
